sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the College Course Materials Affordability and Equitable Access Collaborative Study  Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the College Course Materials Affordability and Equitable Access Collaborative Study Act.

sections.heading: College Course Materials Affordability and Equitable Access Task Force; membership.
sections.text: College Course Materials Affordability and Equitable Access Task Force; membership.

sections.heading: Collaboration. As part of the College Course Materials Affordability and Equitable Access Task Force's information gathering process to prepare its report under Section 20, the Task Force shall engage and consult with higher education administrators, faculty, campus bookstores, publishers, librarian
sections.text: Collaboration. As part of the College Course Materials Affordability and Equitable Access Task Force's information gathering process to prepare its report under Section 20, the Task Force shall engage and consult with higher education administrators, faculty, campus bookstores, publishers, librarians, and other online education specialists for their perspectives on the topics covered by this Act. The Task Force may also seek advice and input from such other persons and entities as the Task Force finds helpful to its work as outlined in this Act.

sections.heading: Repeal. This Act is repealed on March 31, 2025.
sections.text: Repeal. This Act is repealed on March 31, 2025.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
